children.text: We are given three Python programs that run in sequence.
children.label: high_level_plan

children.text:
The output of the first becomes the input of the second, and the output of the second becomes the input of the third. First program (File1):
   - Reads a list of integers from input.
   - Finds the first occurrence of 0 and prints the 1-based index of that element.
children.label: mental_execution

children.text:
However, note: the entire chain must be converted to a single C program without intermediate I/O.

Our C program: 
             Reads the line "1 2 0 3"
             Tokenizes: tokens are "1", "2", "0", then breaks at "0". index=3. Then step3: n=3 -> 3%2 ! =0 -> then check 3==1? no -> output "NO". Another test: 
          Input: "0 1 2"
          First program: first zero at position 1 -> output "1\n"
          Second program: reads "1\n", then outputs "1\n" (same)
          Third program: n=1 -> then after the loop (since 1%2 ! =0, so skip loop) -> then 1==1 -> "YES"

          Our C program: 
             Reads the line "0 1 2"
             The first token is "0" -> position=1 -> index=1. Then step3: n=1 -> then 1==1 -> output "YES"

        Another test: Input: "1 0 2 0"
          First program: first zero at position 2 -> output "2\n"
          Third program: n=2 -> 2%2==0 -> n=1 -> then 1==1 -> "YES"

        Our C program: 
             Reads "1 0 2 0": first token "1" (pos1), then "0" (pos2) -> found at pos2. Then step3: n=2 -> 2%2==0 -> n=1 -> then output "YES"

        One more: 
          Input: "1 2 3 4 0" -> first zero at position 5.
          Step3: 5 -> 5%2!=0 -> then n=5 -> not 1 -> "NO"

        But 5 is not a power of two -> correct. And 4: 
          Input: "1 2 3 0 5" -> first zero at position 4. Step3: 4 -> 4/2=2, 2/2=1 -> then n=1 -> "YES"

        So the program is correct. We assume the input line is within 1000 characters? The problem doesn't specify, but we can use a safe buffer.
